meanings.definition: To divide or distribute something again
meanings.sent1: After the argument, they decided to repartition the chores among the siblings.
meanings.sent2: The company is repartitioning the office space to create more collaborative areas.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly threatened to repartition the candy if the students didn't behave.
meanings.sent4: The artist repartitioned the colors on the canvas to create a more balanced composition.
meanings.sent5: The chef skillfully repartitioned the ingredients to make a visually appealing dish.

meanings.definition: The act of redistributing or reallocating something
meanings.sent1: The repartitioning of resources led to a more equitable distribution among the team.
meanings.sent2: The repartitioning of funds caused a stir among the stakeholders.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected repartitioning of seating arrangements confused the students.
meanings.sent4: The repartitioning of responsibilities in the project team brought about a positive change.
meanings.sent5: The repartitioning of tasks improved the efficiency of the workflow.
